intro: Salicornia peregrina, commonly known as sea beans, is a halophytic plant that thrives in saline environments. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae, characterized by its succulent, salt-tolerant stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or reddish in color. It is often found in coastal areas, salt marshes, and other moist, saline habitats. Salicornia peregrina plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
